intro: Myrsine altomontana, commonly known as the mountain myrsine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth, glossy surface. The flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are clustered in dense inflorescences, making it an attractive plant for ornamental purposes.
